Headline: Founder Topseer, Ex - AVP Product @ HealthKart | Product Strategy,Machine Learning
Comment:
I always struggle with the basics. Who is a first time founder? Someone who started 6 months ago or even 6 years ago? Someone who is chasing the same idea vs someone pivoted along the way? Who is a second time founder? Who quit too soon and is able to talk about ‚Äòthree‚Äô lessons he learned from that?¬†

I often find it a simple-and-misrepresentative, sweet, 2x2 - first time vs second time and better odds vs not so.

And last, the implicit causation - experience -> discipline -> odds of success. What I have also seen equally pervasive is ‚Äòearly success -> better perspective -> experience‚Äô, and more success that‚Äôs fed back to one‚Äôs operating loop.
